item.title: Word of the Day: exonerate
item.description: This word has appeared in 29 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year. Can you use it in a sentence?
item.dc:creator: The Learning Network

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel Thanks Trump for Google Superstardom in 2025
item.description: The host said he wouldn’t have been the third-most-trending person in Google searches this year “without the support of loyal viewers” like the president.
item.dc:creator: Trish Bendix
item.category: The Daily Show with Jon Stewart (TV Program)
Late Show with Stephen Colbert (TV Program)

item.title: Cary-Hiroyuki Tagawa, ‘Mortal Kombat’ Actor, Dies at 75
item.description: The actor, born in Japan, starred in dozens of film and television shows, including Amazon’s “The Man in the High Castle.” His career spanned more than three decades.
item.dc:creator: Qasim Nauman

media:content.media:description: Cary-Hiroyuki Tagawa in 2019.

item.title: Warner Bros. Discovery and Netflix Said to Be in Exclusive Talks
item.description: Netflix would acquire Warner television and film studios as well as HBO Max in a deal that would bulk up the world’s biggest paid streaming service.
item.dc:creator: Brooks Barnes

media:content.media:description: Netflix headquarters in Los Gatos, Calif.

item.title: Avocado Prices Keep Going Up. Blame Narcoinflation.
item.description: Cartel extortion is pushing up prices in Mexico — and becoming a political problem President Claudia Sheinbaum can’t ignore.
item.dc:creator: Ioan Grillo

media:content.media:description: An avocado tree in Michoacán, Mexico, June 2024. The state, which supplies most avocados destined for the United States, has been the site of rising cartel violence.

item.title: As Trump Covets Nobel Peace Prize, FIFA Cozies Up to Him With Its Own Award
item.description: Gianni Infantino, head of soccer’s governing body, has been ingratiating himself with the president to help ensure a successful 2026 World Cup.
item.dc:creator: Tariq Panja and Luke Broadwater
item.category: Kennedy, John F, Center for the Performing Arts

media:content.media:credit: Tierney L. Cross/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: President Trump, holding a replica of the men’s World Cup, with Gianni Infantino, the president of FIFA, in the Oval Office in August. Mr. Trump later asked to keep the trophy.

item.title: Trump’s Relationship With the President of FIFA
item.description: Gianni Infantino, head of soccer’s governing body, FIFA, has lauded President Trump at almost every opportunity, even starting a FIFA Peace Prize after Mr. Trump didn’t win the Nobel. Luke Broadwater, a White House reporter, describes the bromance.
item.dc:creator: Luke Broadwater, Karen Hanley and James Surdam

item.title: On Pope Leo’s Visit to Lebanon and Turkey, A.I. Was a Frequent Concern
item.description: On his first trip as pontiff, Leo XIV predictably called for peace and unity. But he also addressed technology’s promise and pitfalls.
item.dc:creator: Motoko Rich

media:content.media:credit: Diego Ibarra Sanchez for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Pope Leo in Bkerke, Lebanon, on Monday. During his six-day tour, he called out the risks of artificial intelligence and other rapidly advancing technologies.

item.title: Yemen’s Civil War Could Escalate Again. Here’s What to Know.
item.description: An armed group backed by the United Arab Emirates has pushed into the oil-rich province of Hadramout, a move that could reignite conflict in Yemen after years of a stalemate.
item.dc:creator: Ismaeel Naar and Vivian Nereim

media:content.media:description: Forces loyal to the Southern Transitional Council during clashes with pro-government forces in Abyan province, Yemen, in 2020.

item.title: Corrections: Dec. 5, 2025
item.description: Corrections that appeared in print on Friday, Nov. 5, 2025.

item.title: It Took Them Five Months to Meet. Then Only Six Weeks to Commit.
item.description: Sabrina Soto, a former HGTV host, and Nate Whitney, an MLB physical therapist, had a slow start to a speedy commitment.
item.dc:creator: Jenny Block

item.title: She Needed Help Setting Up Appliances. Her Future Husband Knocked at the Door.
item.description: When Melissa Cormier first met Devon Mistry in her high-rise, he was the construction manager who offered a helping hand.
item.dc:creator: Emily Lang

item.title: On His Healing Journey, He Wrote 300 Letters to His Future Wife
item.description: Laterras Whitfield, the host of the hit podcast “Dear Future Wifey,” revealed his longtime partner, Ashley Woods, to fans as she walked down the aisle during a ceremony streamed to thousands.
item.dc:creator: Tammy LaGorce

item.title: My Rebound Relationship With a Robot
item.description: Raised on a commune, I resisted technology at every step. Until it saved me.
item.dc:creator: Adele Uddo

item.title: From New York Beginnings to a Palm Beach Wedding
item.description: A long-distance start didn’t deter Emily Kelly and Jordan Bargas, who built a life together between New York and Florida and married at the Flagler Museum.
item.dc:creator: Donna Kim

item.title: Quote of the Day: Spain Wants to Be a Beacon for Immigrants. But Only Some.
item.description: Quotation of the Day for Friday, December 5, 2025.

item.title: NYT Crossword Answers for Dec. 5, 2025
item.description: James McCarron’s second puzzle in The New York Times is packed with lively entries.
item.dc:creator: Deb Amlen

media:content.media:description: Taking “a little off the top” does not always mean getting a haircut.

item.title: Human Remains Found Buried at San Diego Home
item.description: Prosecutors are looking at potential connections to a former resident, who faces a murder charge in another case.
item.dc:creator: Jill Cowan

media:content.media:description: Law enforcement personnel carrying out a search warrant on a San Diego home this week found human remains on the property.

item.title: Second Strike Scrutiny Obscures Larger Question About Trump’s Boat Attacks
item.description: Congress is focusing on two deaths in one strike. But nine other people died in that same attack, and the United States has killed 87 in all. Were any of those killings legal?
item.dc:creator: Charlie Savage and Julian E. Barnes
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:credit: Tierney L. Cross/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Adm. Frank M. Bradley attended a classified meeting with lawmakers on Capitol Hill.

item.title: Judge Dismisses Harvard Antisemitism Lawsuit by a Former Student
item.description: Yoav Segev said he was harassed “for being Jewish and Israeli” during a campus protest in October 2023, an episode that had drawn the attention of Republicans in Washington.
item.dc:creator: Mark Arsenault

media:content.media:credit: Pat Greenhouse/The Boston Globe, via Getty Images
media:content.media:description: Protesters formed a wall with scarves around Yoav Segev at a “die-in” protest on the Harvard campus on Oct. 18, 2023.

item.title: Trump Trumpets Peace in Africa Amid War on Drug Boats, in Day of Dissonance
item.description: President Trump presided over a Congo-Rwanda peace deal on the same day his administration was being questioned about potential war crimes.
item.dc:creator: Shawn McCreesh
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
US Strikes on Alleged Drug Traffickers (2025- )

media:content.media:description: President Trump trumpeted a peace agreement while hosting President Paul Kagame of Rwanda and President Felix Tshisekedi of the Democratic Republic of Congo in Washington on Thursday.

item.title: Where Is Jacob? His Mother Won’t Say, and the Police Cannot Find Him.
item.description: Jacob Pritchett, 11, has been missing for months. A judge has said his mother must remain at Rikers Island until she reveals his whereabouts.
item.dc:creator: Maria Cramer and Cassidy Jensen

media:content.media:credit: Dakota Santiago for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Police Department investigators searched and sealed a Brooklyn apartment as part of the effort to find an 11-year-old boy.

item.title: The One Child Policy’s Legacy: A Surplus of Single Men
item.description: A decade after the end of the one-child policy, China has over 30 million so-called surplus men. Can this dating boot camp help them find love?
item.dc:creator: Violet Du Feng

item.title: Trump Returns Coast Guard Helicopter to Oregon Fishing Town After Uproar
item.description: Some residents in Newport, Ore., believed that the Trump administration had removed its Coast Guard rescue helicopter to make way for an immigration detention site.
item.dc:creator: Anna Griffin
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:description: A Coast Guard rescue helicopter was stationed in Newport, Ore., after a maritime disaster in 1985 killed three people.

item.title: Only the Lonely
item.description: A decade after the end of the one-child policy, China has over 30 million so-called surplus men. Can this dating boot camp help them find love?
item.dc:creator: Violet Du Feng

item.title: Stellantis Is in Default for Moving Jeep Production to U.S., Canada Says
item.description: The automaker switched production from Ontario in a bid to please President Trump. But the company defaulted on contracts covering hundreds of millions of dollars in assistance, Canada said.
item.dc:creator: Ian Austen and Matina Stevis-Gridneff

media:content.media:credit: Ian Willms for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Stellantis’s plant in Brampton, Canada. The European-based automaker also produces vehicles under the Chrysler, Dodge and Ram brands in North America.

item.title: Trump Switches Architects for White House Ballroom Project
item.description: The president had clashed with the original designer and insisted on increasing the size and scope of the ballroom on a short timeline.
item.dc:creator: Erica L. Green

media:content.media:description: The demolition of the East Wing of the White House in October.

item.title: Art Gallery Shows to See in December
item.description: This week in Newly Reviewed, Martha Schwendener covers Meredith James’s anti-architecture monument, Franz Gertsch’s take on Patti Smith, Ragnar Kjartansson’s postcard ode, Analivia Cordeiro’s merging bodies and Guanyu Xu’s hovering photos.
item.dc:creator: Martha Schwendener

item.title: 5 New and Renewed Hotels for Your Next Caribbean Vacation
item.description: From Antigua to Grenada, many of the region’s most inviting recent openings are in less expected areas.
item.dc:creator: Sara Clemence

item.title: Tim Walz Calls Trump’s Tirade Against Somalis in Minnesota ‘Vile’
item.description: Minnesota’s governor said the president’s xenophobic remarks were dangerous as the state continued to face fiscal questions about a fraud scandal.
item.dc:creator: Ernesto Londoño

media:content.media:description: Gov. Tim Walz of Minnesota during an appearance in Washington in June.

item.title: Trump Officials Cut Length of Work Permits for Asylum Seekers and Refugees
item.description: The move was the latest in an intensifying crackdown on legal immigration after an Afghan national was charged with shooting two National Guard members.
item.dc:creator: Madeleine Ngo

media:content.media:description: A line outside a Los Angeles building housing U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services in June. Some migrants will now have to renew their work permits every 18 months instead of every five years.

item.title: Florida Republicans Start Redistricting Talks, but Some Aren’t in a Rush
item.description: Redistricting talks in Florida got off to a slow start on Thursday, as state lawmakers grapple with political and legal questions amid internal power struggles.
item.dc:creator: Patricia Mazzei and Nick Corasaniti

media:content.media:description: Protesters outside the Florida Capitol building in Tallahassee. A House redistricting committee met for the first time on Thursday.

item.title: Supreme Court Clears Way for Texas Redistricting Maps Pushed by Trump
item.description: Texas officials had asked the court to allow the state to use the new maps in the midterm elections, part of a push by President Trump to gain a partisan advantage.
item.dc:creator: Abbie VanSickle
item.category: League of United Latin American Citizens

media:content.media:description: State Representative Matt Morgan, a Republican, holds a map of the new proposed congressional districts in Texas in August.

item.title: Grand Jury Said to Decline to Re-Indict Letitia James
item.description: After a judge dismissed the Trump administration’s first attempt to indict the attorney general of New York State, a new grand jury effort failed, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Devlin Barrett and Jonah E. Bromwich
item.category: New York State Criminal Case Against Trump (71543-23)

media:content.media:credit: Allison Robbert for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Letitia James, New York’s attorney general, has long been in President Trump’s crosshairs.

item.title: Lawmakers Split on the Military’s Defense of Boat Strikes
item.description: Also, a man was arrested on charges of planting pipe bombs before Jan. 6. Here’s the latest at the end of Thursday.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Cullen

media:content.media:credit: Tierney L. Cross/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Adm. Frank M. Bradley, left, and Gen. Dan Caine, chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff.

item.title: New Dietary Guidelines Delayed Until Early 2026
item.description: The updated Dietary Guidelines for Americans will not come until the new year, a government official said.
item.dc:creator: Alice Callahan

media:content.media:description: Robert F. Kennedy Jr., the health secretary, had said he would release the new guidelines in the summer, but they have been delayed.

item.title: Suspect Is Arrested in D.C. Pipe Bomb Investigation
item.description: Federal agents arrested a 30-year-old man from Prince William County, Va., on Thursday. The suspect is accused of planting two pipe bombs near the Capitol before the Jan. 6 riot.
item.dc:creator: Jorge Mitssunaga

media:content.media:description: A photograph released by the F.B.I. shows the person suspected of placing two pipe bombs on Capitol Hill the night before Jan. 6, 2021.

item.title: El exjefe de campaña de Trump asesoró a candidato presidencial hondureño
item.description: Brad Parscale trabajó para impulsar a Nasry Asfura, representante de derecha que recibió el respaldo del mandatario estadounidense.
item.dc:creator: Kenneth P. Vogel, David C. Adams and Jack Nicas

media:content.media:credit: Al Drago para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Brad Parscale dirigió la campaña de reelección del presidente Trump en 2020.

item.title: Iban a reparar su tejado. Entonces aparecieron los agentes de migración
item.description: Las deportaciones del gobierno de Trump repercuten más allá de las comunidades de migrantes mientras los agentes se despliegan por Nueva Orleans.
item.dc:creator: Eduardo Medina

media:content.media:description: Los agentes, entre ellos varios de la Patrulla Fronteriza, se presentaron e intentaron detener a los hombres, pero estos se negaron a bajar del tejado.

item.title: N.Y.P.D. Officers Won’t Be Charged in Fatal Shooting of Queens Man
item.description: Win Rozario, who had called 911 in distress, was holding scissors when two police officers shot him. The New York attorney general said it was unlikely the officers would be convicted.
item.dc:creator: Maria Cramer and Maia Coleman

media:content.media:credit: Victor J. Blue for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A demonstration after the fatal shooting of Win Rozario, 19, by police officers responding to a 911 call at his Queens home in March 2024.

item.title: Taiwan’s Leader Warns China Is Getting More Aggressive
item.description: President Lai Ching-te is calling for more military spending.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Ross Sorkin, Evan Roberts, Dan Powell, Kelly Pieklo, Katie McMurran and Brian O’Keefe

item.title: MrBeast Isn’t Looking for Controversy
item.description: YouTube’s most popular entertainer reflects on the creator economy.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Ross Sorkin, Evan Roberts, Dan Powell, Kelly Pieklo, Katie McMurran and Brian O’Keefe

item.title: Halle Berry’s Journey to Being a Women’s Health Advocate
item.description: The actor shares how a misdiagnosis sparked her to take on the cause of raising awareness about menopause.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Ross Sorkin, Evan Roberts, Dan Powell, Kelly Pieklo, Katie McMurran and Brian O’Keefe

item.title: Anthropic Chief Executive Has A.I. Bubble ‘Concerns’
item.description: Dario Amodei discusses the risk of investing too much in data centers vs. not enough.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Ross Sorkin, Evan Roberts, Dan Powell, Kelly Pieklo, Katie McMurran and Brian O’Keefe

item.title: G.M.’s Chief Executive Remains Bullish on Fuel-Efficient Motors
item.description: Mary Barra of General Motors says her company will continue investing in more fuel-efficient cars, regardless of Trump administration policies.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Ross Sorkin, Evan Roberts, Dan Powell, Kelly Pieklo, Katie McMurran and Brian O’Keefe

item.title: Several Countries Boycott Eurovision 2026 Over Israel’s Participation
item.description: Spain, Ireland, the Netherlands and Slovenia said that they were boycotting next year’s Eurovision Song Contest because Israel would continue to be allowed in the competition.
item.dc:creator: McKinnon de Kuyper

media:content.media:description: Yuval Raphael, Israel’s 2025 Eurovision act, performing in May. The country has won the contest four times.

item.title: Biden to Attend First Event for Presidential Library
item.description: His plans for the library have been slow to take shape, but he has invited potential donors to a holiday reception in Washington this month.
item.dc:creator: Shane Goldmacher and David A. Fahrenthold

media:content.media:credit: Christopher Smith for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Former President Joseph R. Biden Jr. appeared at a gala for the Nebraska Democratic Party last month in Omaha.

item.title: Appeals Court Pauses, for Now, Order Blocking National Guard in Washington
item.description: A week after the president surged more members of the National Guard to Washington, an appeals court halted an order that would have required the Guard to pull out after Dec. 11.
item.dc:creator: Zach Montague
item.category: US Federal Takeover of Metropolitan Police Dept (DC)
United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Members of the National Guard on the National Mall in August.

item.title: When Kids Adopt New Technologies, Hype Can Turn to Backlash
item.description: The arc of mobile phones and social media may foretell the future of artificial intelligence in schools.
item.dc:creator: Katrin Bennhold

media:content.media:credit: Matthew Abbott for The New York Times

item.description: The highway that one of the subjects was assaulted outside of San Diego.
item.dc:creator: Erin Schaff/the New York Times
